passages.text:
xyz! What a good name. Currently, you are both staring at each other while sitting on the floor. What do you want to do first? 
[[Poke]] it. 
Continue [[staring]] to see if it breaks eye contact first. 
Get it some [[water]]. 
[[Pet]] it.
passages.name: first

passages.text:
xyz does not respond well to that; it jumps and flaps around a little, looking nervous, before slowly settling down back into it's place and looking at you with wide, annoyed eyes. You're a little afraid of an angry alien, so next you decide to...
[[Pet]] it slowly. 
Try to give it a [[treat]]. 
Leave it [[alone]] for a little while.
passages.name: Poke

passages.text:
The creature stares after you, unnerved but still bold. You find amusement in the little guy being so sure of itself, so you break eye contact first. This seems to calm it--success! xyz blinks slowly at you and then also drops it's gaze. Now what should you do? 
It's almost lunchtime; make some [[food]]. 
You realize it might be thirsty. Get it some [[water]]. 
Snap a [[picture]] of it on your phone.
passages.name: staring

passages.text:
The sink isn't far away; you put some water in a bowl and set it down in front of xyz carefully. It sniffs it a little, makes a face, and then hisses at you, flattening it's ears and curling away. Surprised, you take the bowl away. Maybe water didn't exist on this creature's planet? 
[[Ask]] the creature what it likes to drink. 
Abandon the concept of nourishment and bring a [[pillow]] for the creature to sleep on.
[[Give up]] and take the creature back outside.
passages.name: water

passages.text:
Being as careful as you can to not surprise it, you extend your hand out and begin to pet little xyz. It freezes for a moment and glares suspiciously, likely not sure what you're doing, but after the third or fourth pet it relaxes into your touch. A clicking sound fills the room, and you look wildly around for something broken before realizing, oh, it's xyz! It's purring, only more weirdly! How delightful. You pet it for a while. Then...
You make lunch for yourself and offer some [[food]] to the creature as well.
Snap a [[picture]] of the creature.
passages.name: Pet

passages.text:
You dig out a couple of grapes from your fridge and offer them to xyz. To your surprise, it eats them immediately and seems to really like them! Now it's acting a little more comfortable. 
Take a [[picture]] of it acting so cute.
Offer it some more substantial [[food]].
See if it enjoys [[video games]]!
passages.name: treat

passages.text:
You decide to leave xyz alone for a while, thinking maybe it needs it's space. xyz, however, only seems sad about this, which also makes you feel sad about it. You return to the creature and...
Try to strike up a conversation. [[Ask]] the creature what it is. 
Give the creature a [[treat]].
Take the creature on a [[walk]].
passages.name: alone

passages.text:
You make xyz a salad, because you want to teach it good habits. You even cut some more grapes and put them in there! While the creature seems vaguely overwhelmed by the sudden amount of nourishment, eventually it eats the salad happily, even giving your knee a tentative lick when it's done! Now...
You offer the creature a [[pillow]]. 
You flip on the [[TV]], to see if the creature enjoys shows. 
You start to play [[video games]] with it.
passages.name: food

passages.text:
You pull out your phone and snap a quick picture of xyz! Alas, it doesn't seem to like the flash. 
[[Apologize]] to the creature for the flash. 
Get the creature [[food]].
passages.name: picture

passages.text:
xyz doesn't seem to understand English or talk very much, but it DOES tilt it's head to the side and make it's eyes rounder, which is pretty adorable. You forgive it for its lack of communication skills. 
Give the creature a [[treat]] for being cute.
Offer to watch [[TV]] with it. 
Take the creature on a [[walk]].
passages.name: Ask

passages.text:
You give xyz a soft pillow to lay on. It curls up happily! Yay!
Once it wakes up, show it the [[TV]]. 
Once it wakes up, take it on a [[walk]].
Once it wakes up, play [[video games]] with it.
passages.name: pillow

passages.text:
After you do this, your insides twist together, knotted with guilt and dread at the thought of someone not so understanding finding xyz next. You open up the door to find it still sitting sadly outside, head bowed, looking scared. Your heart clenches. You take it back inside. 
Give it an apology [[treat]].
passages.name: Give up

passages.text:
You try to show xyz earth culture through video games! It doesnâ€™t seem to be happy whenever you play something where humans fight aliens. The two of you play for so long, however, that by the time you're done, it's late! 
Take the creature to [[bed]].
Decide that the responsiblity of caring for an alien is too great, and say [[goodbye]].
passages.name: video games

passages.text:
You turn on the TV to try and get xyz acquainted with human culture (like in ET!). It seems to like cooking shows. However, it's getting late now and you both seem tired.
Tuck the creature into [[bed]]. 
Decide that the responsibility of caring for an alien is too great and say [[goodbye]].
passages.name: TV

passages.text:
You decide that xyz should see more of the world and take it on a walk after rigging up a leash. Youâ€™re sure to avoid heavily populated places so it doesnâ€™t get taken to Area 51. By the time the two of you return, it's getting late! 
Take the creature to [[bed]].
Decide that the responsibility of taking care of an alien is too great, and say [[goodbye]].
passages.name: walk

passages.text:
You apologize for the flash scaring xyz, giving it a small pet as recompense. You seem to be back in it's good graces! 
Let it watch some [[TV]]. 
Take it on a [[walk]].
Play [[video games]] with it.
passages.name: Apologize

passages.text: You let xyz sleep in your bed, 80% sure it wonâ€™t alien-kill you in your sleep. Sweet dreams, enjoy your new xyz, your new pet alien!
passages.name: bed

passages.text:
You decide that having a pet alien is too much responsibility and go back to where you found it, setting it down and beginning to walk away slowly. However, right as it's disappearing from sight, your conscience seizes you, and you rush back and scoop it up again, apologizing the whole time. How could you have almost abandoned it! How silly of you! You both head back home. 
Take it to [[bed]].
passages.name: goodbye
